CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 26, 1959, pg. 1, reads: "Getting the Point - Although the administration of a polio shot is not painful, you might believe that it is from the looks on Jesse Griffin's face as he 'gets the point' of inoculation from Dr. Isreal [Israel] Feldman, during a polio clinic at Hill City. The clinic was sponsored by the L'Egants Club. Looking at Christine Griffin, left, it is hard to tell whether brother or sister suffered the most. Mrs. Eunice Cook, Hill City staffer, stands in background. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Doctor Israel Feldman administering polio vaccination to Jesse Griffin, as his sister Christine Griffin winces, and with nurse Eunice Cook in background, at Hill City polio clinic
